questions.question_text: Complete the sentence. A set of architecture principles that are enduring and yet able to accommodate change meets the recommended criteria of__________.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
This aligns with the TOGAF definition of stability in the context of architecture principles, as described in Part III, Chapter 20: Architecture Principles, in the TOGAF 9.2 standard.

Selected Answer: C
20.4 Developing Architecture Principles
20.4.1 Qualities of Principles
Stable: principles should be enduring, yet able to accommodate changes

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap20.html

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of the Standards Information Base within the Architecture Repository?

choices.C: It defines the parameters, structures, and processes to support governance
choices.E: It provides standard templates and patterns that must be used to create new architectures
choices.A: It describes the organization specific architecture framework and method
choices.D: It lists the set of specifications to which architectures must conform
choices.B: It provides a record of the governance activity across the enterprise

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
37.4 Standards Information Base
37.4.1 Overview
The Standards Information Base provides a repository area to hold a set of specifications, to which architectures must conform. Establishment of a Standards Information Base provides an unambiguous basis for Architecture Governance because:
• The standards are easily accessible to projects and therefore the obligations of the project can be understood and planned for
• Standards are stated in a clear and unambiguous manner, so that compliance can be objectively assessed

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap37.html

questions.question_text: Which of the following identifies business units that possess capabilities, and which participate in value streams?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is the correct answer

Selected Answer: B
4.5.5 Applying the Organization Map

While capability mapping exposes what a business does and value stream mapping exposes how it delivers value to specific stakeholders, the organization map identities the business units or third parties that possess or use those capabilities and which participate in the value streams.

Answer should be A
"Business Capability Mapping: identifies, categorizes, and decomposes the business capabilities required for the business to have the ability to deliver value to one or more stakeholders"
https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap07.html

Selected Answer: B
1 Introduction

the organization map identifies the business units or third parties that possess or use those capabilities, and which participate in the value streams.

https://pubs.opengroup.org/togaf-standard/business-architecture/organization-mapping.html

questions.question_text: What component of the Architecture Repository is an architectural representation of SBBs supporting the Architecture Landscape?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
37.1 Overview
• The Solutions Landscape presents an architectural representation of the Solution Building Blocks (SBBs) supporting the Architecture Landscape which have been planned or deployed by the enterprise

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap37.html

questions.question_text: Which of the following best describes the purpose of the TOGAF Library?

choices.C: To accelerate the creation of new architectures for the enterprise
choices.B: A classification mechanism for artifacts and other outputs produced by execution of the TOGAF ADM
choices.D: A set of standard Reference Architectures that can be used within an enterprise architecture
choices.A: To document the body of knowledge for TOGAF certification

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
This is described in Part I, Chapter 1, Section 1.2: Structure of the TOGAF Library, in the TOGAF 9.2 standard. The library is intended to offer practical guidance for applying the TOGAF approach effectively.

Selected Answer: C
1.2 Structure of the TOGAF Library
Accompanying this standard is a portfolio of guidance material, known as the TOGAF Library, to support the practical application of the TOGAF approach. The TOGAF Library is a reference library containing guidelines, templates, patterns, and other forms of reference material to accelerate the creation of new architectures for the enterprise.


https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/
